original: de ni 'dus pa can gyi dngos po 'brel chags su gnas pa nyid la brtags shing 'dus pa can rang yang de ltar snang ba tsam la brtags kyi sngar bstan pa ltar dngos por grub pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de ni 'dus pa can gyi dngos po 'brel chags su gnas pa nyid la brtags shing 'dus pa can rang yang de ltar snang ba tsam la brtags kyi sngar bstan pa ltar dngos por grub pa med pa'o //
translated: It is imputed to the aggregation of things that are related and that endure. The aggregation of things is imputed to the mere appearance of the aggregation of things. As was previously explained, it does not exist as a thing.

original: phan tshun ltos la 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: phan tshun ltos la 'brel pa'o //
translated: They are related through mutual dependence.

original: zhes pa ni 'dus pa phan tshun ltos shing 'brel pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni 'dus pa phan tshun ltos shing 'brel pa ste /
translated: This means that the aggregation is related through mutual dependence.

original: de nyid kyi phyir na yang 'di dag don dam par mi 'thad pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir na yang 'di dag don dam par mi 'thad pa'o //
translated: For that very reason, they are not tenable ultimately.

original: yang na 'di rnams kyi don ni rgyu dang 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pa ni brtags pa tsam nyid de /
analyzed: yang na 'di rnams kyi don ni rgyu dang 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pa ni brtags pa tsam nyid de /
translated: Alternatively, the meaning of this verse is that the presentation of cause and effect is mere imputation.

original: phan tshun ltos pa'i sgo nas 'brel pa ste /
analyzed: phan tshun ltos pa'i sgo nas 'brel pa ste /
translated: They are related through mutual dependence.

original: de nyid kyi phyir don dam par ma grub ces sngar rgyas par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir don dam par ma grub ces sngar rgyas par bstan pa'o //
translated: For that very reason, they are not ultimately established. This was extensively explained earlier.

original: rkyen rnams 'brel las zhes pa la sogs pa'i don ni kun rdzob tu ma rig pa dang 'du byed la sogs pa'i rkyen @226b rnams gang gi mjug thogs su gang nges par 'byung ba nyid de rnams kyi 'brel pa ste /
analyzed: rkyen rnams 'brel las zhes pa la sogs pa'i don ni kun rdzob tu ma rig pa dang 'du byed la sogs pa'i rkyen @226b rnams gang gi mjug thogs su gang nges par 'byung ba nyid de rnams kyi 'brel pa ste /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúfrom the connection of conditions‚Äù and so on is that in the relative, whatever arises immediately after whatever conditions, such as ignorance and compositional activity, that is their connection.

original: de las logs shig ni bskyed par bya ba'i don 'bras bu'i dngos po las tha dad pa'i chos su phyi rol pas brtags pa ni med ces pa'o //
analyzed: de las logs shig ni bskyed par bya ba'i don 'bras bu'i dngos po las tha dad pa'i chos su phyi rol pas brtags pa ni med ces pa'o //
translated: Apart from that, there is no external creation of an effect that is a different entity from the object to be produced, as imagined by non-Buddhists.

original: des na de ltar rtog pa'i mu stegs can gyi nyes pa spangs shing nyes pa de dang ma 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: des na de ltar rtog pa'i mu stegs can gyi nyes pa spangs shing nyes pa de dang ma 'brel pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the MƒÅdhyamikas are free from the faults of the tƒ´rthikas who imagine in that way, and they are not connected with those faults.

original: gang na zhes pa la sogs pas ni nyes pa dang bcas pa dang mu stegs can gyi lugs dgag pa'o //
analyzed: gang na zhes pa la sogs pas ni nyes pa dang bcas pa dang mu stegs can gyi lugs dgag pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú In what‚Äù and so on reject the system of the tƒ´rthikas and those with faults.

original: 'brel ba rnam par 'jig pa ste zhes pa'i don ni dngos po gang gi rjes su gang zhig nges par byung ba de dang 'brel pa'i 'bras bu'i dngos po las tha dad pa'i bskyed par bya ba'i chos gcig khas len na /
analyzed: 'brel ba rnam par 'jig pa ste zhes pa'i don ni dngos po gang gi rjes su gang zhig nges par byung ba de dang 'brel pa'i 'bras bu'i dngos po las tha dad pa'i bskyed par bya ba'i chos gcig khas len na /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúthe destruction of the connection‚Äù is this: If one maintains that a thing that has arisen in dependence on another is a different thing to be produced from the thing that is its effect,

original: 'dir 'bras bu'i dngos po bskyed dam ma bskyed ces brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir 'bras bu'i dngos po bskyed dam ma bskyed ces brtag par bya'o //
translated: then one should investigate whether or not the effect is produced.

original: gal te bskyed na de nyid bskyed par bya ba'i dngos po yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te bskyed na de nyid bskyed par bya ba'i dngos po yin gyi /
translated: If it is produced, then it is just that which is to be produced.

original: de las gzhan rtog pa don med do //
analyzed: de las gzhan rtog pa don med do //
translated: To imagine that it is something other than that is pointless.

original: de ltar rtog na yang de la yang gzhan dang gzhan rtog pas thug pa med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar rtog na yang de la yang gzhan dang gzhan rtog pas thug pa med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If one imagines that it is something other than that, then there would be an infinite regress of other things.

original: de ste 'bras bu'i dngos po ma bskyed na de dang rgyur 'dod pa gnyis la 'brel pa med de /
analyzed: de ste 'bras bu'i dngos po ma bskyed na de dang rgyur 'dod pa gnyis la 'brel pa med de /
translated: If the effect is not produced, then there is no connection between the two, the effect and that which is asserted to be its cause.

original: tha dad pas bdag nyid gcig bar mi 'thad cing ma bskyed pas de las byung ba'i 'brel pa yang med pas 'brel pa rnam par 'jig cing 'bras bu rgyu med pa nyid du smra bar 'gyur zhes pa'o //
analyzed: tha dad pas bdag nyid gcig bar mi 'thad cing ma bskyed pas de las byung ba'i 'brel pa yang med pas 'brel pa rnam par 'jig cing 'bras bu rgyu med pa nyid du smra bar 'gyur zhes pa'o //
translated: Since they are different, it is untenable that they are the same nature. Since it is not produced, the relation of arising from that does not exist. Therefore the relation is destroyed, and it is said that the effect is without a cause.

original: gzhan yang grangs can pa rnams kyi zho dang 'o ma la sogs pa rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por khas len pa na /
analyzed: gzhan yang grangs can pa rnams kyi zho dang 'o ma la sogs pa rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por khas len pa na /
translated: Moreover, when the SƒÅ·πÉkhyas assert that yogurt, milk, and so on are things that are cause and effect,

original: 'o ma dang 'brel pa zho'i rang bzhin ni sngar nas yod cing /
analyzed: 'o ma dang 'brel pa zho'i rang bzhin ni sngar nas yod cing /
translated: the nature of yogurt that is related to milk exists from before.

original: 'o ma las tha dad pa ma yin pas bskyed par bya ba ma yin la /
analyzed: 'o ma las tha dad pa ma yin pas bskyed par bya ba ma yin la /
translated: Since it is not different from milk, it is not to be produced.

original: 'on kyang de nyid sngar mi gsal ba las gsal ba'i gnas skabs su rgyu dang rkyen gyis bskyed par bya ba'i dngos po de 'dra ba yod ces pa ni /
analyzed: 'on kyang de nyid sngar mi gsal ba las gsal ba'i gnas skabs su rgyu dang rkyen gyis bskyed par bya ba'i dngos po de 'dra ba yod ces pa ni /
translated: However, they say that the thing to be produced by causes and conditions is that very [yogurt] in the state of being manifest, which was previously unmanifest.

original: 'brel pa rnam par 'jig pa ste /
analyzed: 'brel pa rnam par 'jig pa ste /
translated: This is the destruction of the relation.

original: gsal ba'i gnas skabs gzhan pa nyid rgyu dang rkyen gyis bskyed par bya bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gsal ba'i gnas skabs gzhan pa nyid rgyu dang rkyen gyis bskyed par bya bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: The state of being manifest, which is different, would be produced by causes and conditions.

original: zho la sogs pa'i rang bzhin skye ba mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: zho la sogs pa'i rang bzhin skye ba mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because it is untenable that the nature of curd and so on arises.

original: / des na rgyu med par smra ba nyid du yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: / des na rgyu med par smra ba nyid du yang 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, you would be advocating that they are without a cause.

original: gal te gsal ba'i gnas skabs rgyu dang bcas pas skyon med do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te gsal ba'i gnas skabs rgyu dang bcas pas skyon med do zhe na /
translated: If you say that the phase of manifestation has a cause, there is no error,

original: de 'dra ba'i gnas skabs rgyu'i dus na med par 'dod na ni /
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i gnas skabs rgyu'i dus na med par 'dod na ni /
translated: then if you assert that such a phase does not exist at the time of the cause,

original: 'bras bu rgyu'i dus na yod pa nyid nyams par 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'bras bu rgyu'i dus na yod pa nyid nyams par 'gyur la /
translated: the consequence is that the effect exists at the time of the cause.

original: yod na yang skyes zin pas skye ba @227a * //
analyzed: yod na yang skyes zin pas skye ba @227a * //
translated: If it exists, since it has already arisen,üîΩit is untenable that it arises again.

original: mi 'thad pa'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa 'jig pa dang / rgyu med par smra ba nyid du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: mi 'thad pa'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa 'jig pa dang / rgyu med par smra ba nyid du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the relationship between cause and effect would be destroyed, and you would be advocating that they are without a cause.üîΩTo whom does the thing belong?

original: dngos po su la yod ces pa bskyed bya'i dngos po su'i lugs la yod pa'am /
analyzed: dngos po su la yod ces pa bskyed bya'i dngos po su'i lugs la yod pa'am /
translated: To whom does the thing that is to be generated belong?

original: 'bras bu'i dngos po su la yong na zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i dngos po su la yong na zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Or to whom does the effect belong?

original: de lta na mar mes mun khung na yod pa'i bum pa sngar med pa skyed pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de lta na mar mes mun khung na yod pa'i bum pa sngar med pa skyed pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: In that case, a lamp does not generate a pot that exists in the darkness,

original: yod pa'i don nyid gsal bar byas pa tsam la /
analyzed: yod pa'i don nyid gsal bar byas pa tsam la /
translated: but it merely illuminates the object that exists.

original: de dag 'brel pa 'jog pa bzhin du zho dang bum pa la sogs pa'i rdzas kyi rigs rnams /
analyzed: de dag 'brel pa 'jog pa bzhin du zho dang bum pa la sogs pa'i rdzas kyi rigs rnams /
translated: Just as they posit a connection between the two, in the same way, they posit a connection between the types of substances, such as yogurt and pots, and the substances, such as milk and clay.

original: 'o ma dang 'jim gong la sogs pa la 'brel par 'jog pa dang sngar med pa skyed pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'o ma dang 'jim gong la sogs pa la 'brel par 'jog pa dang sngar med pa skyed pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: They do not generate what did not exist earlier.

original: yod pa'i don nyid gsal bar byed par 'gyur zhes pa'o //üîΩgzhan yang 'bras bu'i dngos po las bskyed par bya ba'i dngos po gzhan du khas len na /
analyzed: yod pa'i don nyid gsal bar byed par 'gyur zhes pa'o // gzhan yang 'bras bu'i dngos po las bskyed par bya ba'i dngos po gzhan du khas len na /
translated: They merely clarify what is already existent.

original: mun pa'i nang gi bum pa sngar nas yod pa la mar mes ci yang skyed pa med cing /
analyzed: mun pa'i nang gi bum pa sngar nas yod pa la mar mes ci yang skyed pa med cing /
translated: Moreover, if you accept that the thing that is the effect is generated from another thing that is the cause, then the lamp would not generate anything at all in a pot that already exists in the darkness.

original: 'on kyang de nyid gsal ba'i blo'i chos su 'gyur ba 'ga' zhig bskyed pa na /
analyzed: 'on kyang de nyid gsal ba'i blo'i chos su 'gyur ba 'ga' zhig bskyed pa na /
translated: However, if it generates something that is a property of the mind that is the clarifier,

original: mi mkhas pas gsal ba nyid bum pa dang tha dad med par zhen pas bum pa yang mar me'i bskyed bya nyid du 'brel par snang ba bzhin du 'bras bu'i dngos po'i rdzas kyi rigs rnams la rgyu yis ci yang ma byas mod kyi /
analyzed: mi mkhas pas gsal ba nyid bum pa dang tha dad med par zhen pas bum pa yang mar me'i bskyed bya nyid du 'brel par snang ba bzhin du 'bras bu'i dngos po'i rdzas kyi rigs rnams la rgyu yis ci yang ma byas mod kyi /
translated: then the unwise would conceive the clarifier to be not different from the pot. Therefore, it would appear that the pot is related to being the product of the lamp. In the same way, the cause does not do anything to the types of substances that are the things that are the effects.

original: bskyed par bya ba'i chos gzhan zhig byas pas de dang 'bras bu'i dngos po tha dad med par zhen pas de yang rgyu la 'brel bar snang bar byed par 'gyur zhes pa'o //
analyzed: bskyed par bya ba'i chos gzhan zhig byas pas de dang 'bras bu'i dngos po tha dad med par zhen pas de yang rgyu la 'brel bar snang bar byed par 'gyur zhes pa'o //
translated: Since it is conceived that the effect is not different from the entity that is produced, it also appears to be related to the cause.

original: ma skyes ngo bo nyid med ces pa ni kun rdzob tsam du yang med pa'o //
analyzed: ma skyes ngo bo nyid med ces pa ni kun rdzob tsam du yang med pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúnot arisen, devoid of intrinsic reality‚Äù means that it does not exist even as a superficial reality.

original: 'phags pas zhes pa la sogs pas ni 'phags pas rtogs pa'i chos nyid ston te /üîΩde'i don ni 'phags pas rtogs shing mngon du byas pa'i chos nyid skye ba med pa ni kun rdzob kyi skye ba bkag pa las /
analyzed: 'phags pas zhes pa la sogs pas ni 'phags pas rtogs pa'i chos nyid ston te / de'i don ni 'phags pas rtogs shing mngon du byas pa'i chos nyid skye ba med pa ni kun rdzob kyi skye ba bkag pa las /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe reality realized by the noble ones‚Äù and so forth teaches the reality that is realized by the noble ones.

original: gzhan rig pa dang stong pa zung du 'jug pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis so so rang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan rig pa dang stong pa zung du 'jug pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis so so rang rig par bya'o //
translated: The meaning of this is as follows: The reality that is realized and actualized by the noble ones, which is non-arisen, is to be personally experienced by non-conceptual exalted wisdom, which is the union of awareness and emptiness, through the negation of superficial arising.

original: skye ba mi 'byung zhes pa ni de 'dra ba'i rnam par rtog pa mi 'byung zhing /
analyzed: skye ba mi 'byung zhes pa ni de 'dra ba'i rnam par rtog pa mi 'byung zhing /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúarising does not occur‚Äù means that such conceptualization does not occur.

original: mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa'i ye shes kyis so so rang rig par bya ba'o //
analyzed: mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa'i ye shes kyis so so rang rig par bya ba'o //
translated: The reality that is to be personally experienced by the wisdom that is the forbearance of the non-arising of phenomena is to be personally experienced by the wisdom that is the forbearance of the non-arising of phenomena.

original: de ltar don dam par skye ba med cing kun rdzob tu rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba tsam du mthong ba na /
analyzed: de ltar don dam par skye ba med cing kun rdzob tu rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba tsam du mthong ba na /
translated: Thus, when one sees that ultimately there is no arising and that conventionally there is mere dependent origination,

original: sems mnyam par 'jog pa ste /
analyzed: sems mnyam par 'jog pa ste /
translated: one's mind is set in equipoise.

original: sa brgyad pa yan chod kyi ye shes chos nyid las gzhan du mi g-yeng pa'o //
analyzed: sa brgyad pa yan chod kyi ye shes chos nyid las gzhan du mi g-yeng pa'o //
translated: That is, the wisdom of the eighth ground and above is not distracted from reality.

original: mi @227b shes zhes pa la sogs pas kun rdzob tu rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i dbye ba bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mi @227b shes zhes pa la sogs pas kun rdzob tu rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i dbye ba bstan pa'o //
translated: The line the ignorant and so on teaches the divisions of dependent origination conventionally.

original: de yang 'khor lo dang 'jim pa la sogs pa las bum pa 'byung ba dang / chu dang sa bon la sogs pa las myu gu 'byung zhing /
analyzed: de yang 'khor lo dang 'jim pa la sogs pa las bum pa 'byung ba dang / chu dang sa bon la sogs pa las myu gu 'byung zhing /
translated: Moreover, a pot arises from a wheel, clay, and so on; a sprout arises from water, a seed, and so on;

original: shing dang me la sogs pa las du ba 'byung ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: shing dang me la sogs pa las du ba 'byung ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: smoke arises from wood, fire, and so on.

original: phyi rol gyi rten 'brel te /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi rten 'brel te /
translated: These are external dependent origination.

original: phyi rol du snang ba nyid la 'jog gi phyi rol dngos ni grub pa med pa'o //
analyzed: phyi rol du snang ba nyid la 'jog gi phyi rol dngos ni grub pa med pa'o //
translated: They are posited as external appearances, but external things do not exist.

original: 'brel pa tsam zhes pa la sogs pas ni tshul gzhan gyi sgo nas pha rol po'i 'dod pa 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: 'brel pa tsam zhes pa la sogs pas ni tshul gzhan gyi sgo nas pha rol po'i 'dod pa 'gog pa'o //
translated: The line mere connection and so on refutes the opponent's position from another perspective.

original: 'brel pa tsam ni 'di dag zhes pa ma brtags na nyams dga' ba sgyu ma lta bu'i rten 'brel ma yin te /
analyzed: 'brel pa tsam ni 'di dag zhes pa ma brtags na nyams dga' ba sgyu ma lta bu'i rten 'brel ma yin te /
translated: Mere connection is not the illusion-like dependent origination that is delightful when not examined, as in ‚Äúthese things.‚ÄùüîΩ

original: rkyen las skye ba don dam pa'i dngos por 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: rkyen las skye ba don dam pa'i dngos por 'dod pa ste /
translated: The mere connection is not the illusion-like dependent origination that is delightful if not examined, but is the assertion that things that arise from conditions are ultimately existent.

original: de ni rigs pa dang lung la mi gnas pa ste /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa dang lung la mi gnas pa ste /
translated: That is not supported by reasoning or scripture.

original: de dag gis gnod par 'gyur ba'o //üîΩgal te zhes pa la sogs pa'i don ni /
analyzed: de dag gis gnod par 'gyur ba'o // gal te zhes pa la sogs pa'i don ni /
translated: It is undermined by those.üîΩThe meaning of ‚ÄúIf there is no produced and producer‚Äù and so on is as follows.

original: gzhan dag de ltar bskyed bya skyed byed kyi dngos po med na /
analyzed: gzhan dag de ltar bskyed bya skyed byed kyi dngos po med na /
translated: If there is no produced and producer,

original: de ltar rtogs pa'i blo yang gang gi rkyen las byung ste mi 'thad pa nyid pas de ltar rtogs par mi rigs zhes rgol ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar rtogs pa'i blo yang gang gi rkyen las byung ste mi 'thad pa nyid pas de ltar rtogs par mi rigs zhes rgol ba'o //
translated: then from what conditions would the mind that realizes that arise? Since that is untenable, it is illogical to realize that.

original: lan gyi don ni rtogs bya'i don dam par skye ba med cing /üîΩkun rdzob tu skye bar snang ba dang / de ltar 'jal ba'i blo ni phan tshun bskyed pa ste /
analyzed: lan gyi don ni rtogs bya'i don dam par skye ba med cing / kun rdzob tu skye bar snang ba dang / de ltar 'jal ba'i blo ni phan tshun bskyed pa ste /
translated: The meaning of the reply is as follows. The ultimate object of realization is not produced.üîΩConventionally, it appears to be produced, and the mind that realizes that arises from that.

original: de dag dbyer med kyang rgyun rgyud phyi ma rnams phan tshun bskyed pa ste /
analyzed: de dag dbyer med kyang rgyun rgyud phyi ma rnams phan tshun bskyed pa ste /
translated: Those are mutually produced.

original: don ni sngar rgyas par bstan no //
analyzed: don ni sngar rgyas par bstan no //
translated: The meaning has been taught extensively above.

original: de'i phyir blo skye ba 'thand pas don de dag kyang kun rdzob tsam du rkyen yin zhing /
analyzed: de'i phyir blo skye ba 'thand pas don de dag kyang kun rdzob tsam du rkyen yin zhing /
translated: Therefore, since the arising of the mind is refuted, those objects are merely conventional conditions,

original: don dam par skye ba med par shes pa'o //
analyzed: don dam par skye ba med par shes pa'o //
translated: and ultimately, one should understand that there is no arising.

original: drod gsher zhes pa la sogs pas ni phyi'i 'byung ba la sogs pa brtags pa nyid du ston pa ste go bar zad do //
analyzed: drod gsher zhes pa la sogs pas ni phyi'i 'byung ba la sogs pa brtags pa nyid du ston pa ste go bar zad do //
translated: The passage beginning ‚ÄúHeat, moisture, and so on‚Äù teaches that external elements and so on are imputed. It is easy to understand.

original: nad pa'i zhes pa la sogs pas ni rten 'brel dngos po nyid du bstan pa'i dgongs don 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: nad pa'i zhes pa la sogs pas ni rten 'brel dngos po nyid du bstan pa'i dgongs don 'chad pa'o //
translated: The passage beginning ‚ÄúThe sick‚Äù explains the intended meaning of the teaching that dependent origination is a thing.

original: de'i don ni ji ltar nad kyi bye brag mi 'dra ba rnams gso bar bya ba'i don du sman pas sman gyi sbyor ba'i bye brag tha dad pa ston mod kyi /
analyzed: de'i don ni ji ltar nad kyi bye brag mi 'dra ba rnams gso bar bya ba'i don du sman pas sman gyi sbyor ba'i bye brag tha dad pa ston mod kyi /
translated: The meaning is as follows. Just as doctors teach different medical applications for the sake of treating the various different types of illnesses,

original: de la gtsug lag tha dad pa ste /
analyzed: de la gtsug lag tha dad pa ste /
translated: there are different scriptures.

original: don du gnyer bya'i 'bras bu'i tha dad pa med pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: don du gnyer bya'i 'bras bu'i tha dad pa med pa de bzhin du /
translated: But in reality, there is no difference in the result that is to be pursued.

original: ngas kyang sems can rnams kyi nyon mongs pa dang dbang po rno rtul gyi bye brag shes nas dbang po rtul pa rnams la rten 'brel la sogs pa dngos po'i ngo bo nyid du yod do zhes ston cing /
analyzed: ngas kyang sems can rnams kyi nyon mongs pa dang dbang po rno rtul gyi bye brag shes nas dbang po rtul pa rnams la rten 'brel la sogs pa dngos po'i ngo bo nyid du yod do zhes ston cing /
translated: I also, knowing the specific afflictions and faculties of sentient beings, teach to those of dull faculties that dependent origination and so forth exist as entities.

original: 'ga' zhig la khyad par du rnam par rig pa 'ga' zhig gi rten 'brel bshad mod @228a * //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig la khyad par du rnam par rig pa 'ga' zhig gi rten 'brel bshad mod @228a * //
translated: And I explain to some the dependent origination of some consciousnesses in particular.

original: kyi ; mthar thug gi rtogs par bya ba'i don ni theg pa chen po gcig nyid yin zhes pa'o //
analyzed: kyi ; mthar thug gi rtogs par bya ba'i don ni theg pa chen po gcig nyid yin zhes pa'o //
translated: But the ultimate object of realization is the one vehicle.

original: yan lag brgyad ldan zhes pa ni yang dag pa'i lta ba dang rtog pa la sogs pa 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad po rnams so //
analyzed: yan lag brgyad ldan zhes pa ni yang dag pa'i lta ba dang rtog pa la sogs pa 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad po rnams so //
translated: The eight members are the eight members of the noble path, right view, right thought, and so forth.

original: zhi ba ni phyin ci log nye bar zhi ba'o //
analyzed: zhi ba ni phyin ci log nye bar zhi ba'o //
translated: Peace is the pacification of error.

original: 'di rnams kyi don zhib tu ni sngar bstan no //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi don zhib tu ni sngar bstan no //
translated: The meaning of these has been explained in detail above.

original: de nas yang zhes pa la sogs pas ni sngar gyi mi rtag pa nyid phan tshun gzhan gyi sgo nas ston pa'o //
analyzed: de nas yang zhes pa la sogs pas ni sngar gyi mi rtag pa nyid phan tshun gzhan gyi sgo nas ston pa'o //
translated: Then again, and so forth, teaches impermanence from the perspective of mutual difference.

original: yang dag pa'am log pa zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyi tshul lugs phyin ci ma log pa dang / gzhan gyis brtags pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'am log pa zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyi tshul lugs phyin ci ma log pa dang / gzhan gyis brtags pa'o //
translated: Correct or incorrect refers to the unmistaken way of the Tathagata himself and to the imagination of others.

original: gzugs nyid mi rtag ces me lce dang glog la sogs pa'i gzugs nyid mi rtag pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gzugs nyid mi rtag ces me lce dang glog la sogs pa'i gzugs nyid mi rtag pa yin gyi /
translated: Former masters explain that form itself is impermanent, the form of a flame, lightning and so on is impermanent,

original: de las gzhan pa rnams ni rtag par 'dod pa'o zhes sngon gyi slob dpon dag gis bshad do //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa rnams ni rtag par 'dod pa'o zhes sngon gyi slob dpon dag gis bshad do //
translated: but other forms are asserted to be permanent.

original: yang phyi rol pa kha cig shes pa ni bdag rtag pa gnyis su med par 'dod la /
analyzed: yang phyi rol pa kha cig shes pa ni bdag rtag pa gnyis su med par 'dod la /
translated: Some non Buddhists assert that consciousness is permanent and nondual and that form itself is impermanent.

original: de las gzhan gzugs nyid mi rtag pa'o zhes zer ro ;
analyzed: de las gzhan gzugs nyid mi rtag pa'o zhes zer ro ;
translated: Others say that form itself is impermanent.

original: / chos thams cad bar chad med par rgyun du rang gi ngang gis 'jig pa 'grol ba zhes pa ni sangs rgyas pa rnams kyi 'dod pa skad cig ma'i mi rtag pa yin la /
analyzed: / chos thams cad bar chad med par rgyun du rang gi ngang gis 'jig pa 'grol ba zhes pa ni sangs rgyas pa rnams kyi 'dod pa skad cig ma'i mi rtag pa yin la /
translated: All phenomena are said to be momentary impermanence, which is the assertion of Buddhists, since all phenomena are uninterruptedly and naturally destroyed.

original: 'grol ba ni de las 'das nas gzhan du bum pa la sogs pa'i dngos po thams cad la sngar gyi gnas skabs mi mthong ba dang / rags pa'i 'jig pa nyid 'jug cing 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: 'grol ba ni de las 'das nas gzhan du bum pa la sogs pa'i dngos po thams cad la sngar gyi gnas skabs mi mthong ba dang / rags pa'i 'jig pa nyid 'jug cing 'brel pa'o //
translated: Liberation is the passing beyond that, and the connection and engagement in the destruction of the gross, the non-seeing of the previous state in all things such as pots.

original: dngos po'i dngos po med pa ni gyo mo la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na /
analyzed: dngos po'i dngos po med pa ni gyo mo la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na /
translated: The non-existence of the entity of an entity is the non-existence of the entity of a pot in the state of shards, etc.

original: bum pa'i dngos po med pa mi rtag pa nyid du 'dod pa'o /
analyzed: bum pa'i dngos po med pa mi rtag pa nyid du 'dod pa'o /
translated: It is asserted that impermanence is the non-existence of the entity of a pot.

original: snga ma ni gyo mo la sogs pa'i dngos por gyur pa nyid mi rtag par 'dod pas mi mtshungs so //
analyzed: snga ma ni gyo mo la sogs pa'i dngos por gyur pa nyid mi rtag par 'dod pas mi mtshungs so //
translated: The former is not similar, because it is asserted that impermanence is the very entity of shards, etc.

original: yang chos can dngos por gyur pa ni mi rtag pa ma yin la /
analyzed: yang chos can dngos por gyur pa ni mi rtag pa ma yin la /
translated: Moreover, the basis of attributes is not impermanent.

original: de'i chos kyi khyad par gzhan du 'gyur zhing med pa ni mi rtag pa'o zhes snga rabs dag gis bshad do //
analyzed: de'i chos kyi khyad par gzhan du 'gyur zhing med pa ni mi rtag pa'o zhes snga rabs dag gis bshad do //
translated: The change and non-existence of the other attributes of that are impermanence. This is explained by the former masters.

original: mi rtag pa yang de yi nang du 'dus //
analyzed: mi rtag pa yang de yi nang du 'dus //
translated: Impermanence is also included in that.

original: zhes pa ni skye ba med pa'i chos nyid kyis de la khyab pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni skye ba med pa'i chos nyid kyis de la khyab pa'o //
translated: This is pervaded by the reality of non-arising.

original: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyis bzhed pa'i don yin la /
analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyis bzhed pa'i don yin la /
translated: This is the meaning intended by the TathƒÅgata himself.

original: gzhan de las bzlog ste skye ba'i dngos po nyid mi rtag pa don dam pa nyid du 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan de las bzlog ste skye ba'i dngos po nyid mi rtag pa don dam pa nyid du 'dod pa'o //
translated: The other is the opposite of that, asserting that the thing that arises is impermanent in the ultimate.

original: de la zhes pa la sogs pas de rnams kyi don rgyas par 'chad de /
analyzed: de la zhes pa la sogs pas de rnams kyi don rgyas par 'chad de /
translated: The meaning of those is explained extensively, beginning with ‚ÄúThere,

original: ngo bo nyid mi 'jug ces pa ni de'i rgyun 'jug pa med pa'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid mi 'jug ces pa ni de'i rgyun 'jug pa med pa'o //
translated: the non-engagement of entities‚Äù means that their continuum does not engage.

original: rtag tu mi rtag pa dang yod pa dang med pa las @228b mi 'byung ba dang / chos thams cad mi mthong ba dang zhes pa la sogs pa'i don ni kun rdzob tu 'du byed skad cig ma nyid ma yin pas rtag tu mi rtag pa yin la /
analyzed: rtag tu mi rtag pa dang yod pa dang med pa las @228b mi 'byung ba dang / chos thams cad mi mthong ba dang zhes pa la sogs pa'i don ni kun rdzob tu 'du byed skad cig ma nyid ma yin pas rtag tu mi rtag pa yin la /
translated: ‚ÄúAlways arising from the impermanent and the existent and the nonexistent‚Äù and ‚Äúnot seeing any phenomena‚Äù and so on means that because compounded phenomena are not momentary conventionally, they are always impermanent.

original: don dam par rgyu yod pa dang med pa las mi 'byung ba dang / 'bras bu yang yod pa dang med pa 'byung ba mi 'thad pa dang / chos thams cad rdul phra rab dang skad cig ma'i bar du brtags na mi mthong ngo zhes brjod pa 'di ni mi skye ba'i tshig bla dags yin gyi /
analyzed: don dam par rgyu yod pa dang med pa las mi 'byung ba dang / 'bras bu yang yod pa dang med pa 'byung ba mi 'thad pa dang / chos thams cad rdul phra rab dang skad cig ma'i bar du brtags na mi mthong ngo zhes brjod pa 'di ni mi skye ba'i tshig bla dags yin gyi /
translated: Ultimately, it is not tenable that they arise from the existent and the nonexistent, and that existent and nonexistent results arise. ‚ÄúNot seeing any phenomena‚Äù means that when all phenomena are analyzed down to the most subtle particles and moments, they are not seen. This is the definition of nonarising,

original: skye ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: skye ba ni ma yin no //
translated: but it is not arising.

original: de ltar na don dam par skye ba med cing kun rdzob tu skad cig ma'i rang bzhin snga ma rnams la rag las te /
analyzed: de ltar na don dam par skye ba med cing kun rdzob tu skad cig ma'i rang bzhin snga ma rnams la rag las te /
translated: Thus, ultimately there is no arising, and conventionally, the characteristics of the later arising depend on the former moments.

original: phyi ma skye ba'i mtshan nyid zung du 'jug pa'i don 'di nyid mi rtag pa yin zhes pa'o //
analyzed: phyi ma skye ba'i mtshan nyid zung du 'jug pa'i don 'di nyid mi rtag pa yin zhes pa'o //
translated: This very meaning of the union of the two characteristics is impermanence.

original: skye ba mi rtag par smra zhes pa la don 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyis kyang /
analyzed: skye ba mi rtag par smra zhes pa la don 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyis kyang /
translated: If one says that arising is impermanent, is this not the meaning of the statement by the TathƒÅgata himself:

original: 'du byed thams cad skad cig ma //üîΩzhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad skad cig ma // zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúAll formations are momentary.‚Äù

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not.

original: de ni kun rdzob pa'i tshul bstan pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de ni kun rdzob pa'i tshul bstan pa yin gyi /
translated: That is a teaching on the mode of the conventional,

original: don dam pa'i de kho na nyid du mi bzhed la /
analyzed: don dam pa'i de kho na nyid du mi bzhed la /
translated: but it is not asserted to be the ultimate reality.

original: gzhan ni don dam pa'i dngos por 'dod pas mi 'thad pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni don dam pa'i dngos por 'dod pas mi 'thad pa'o //
translated: The other is not tenable because it is asserted to be an ultimate thing.

original: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pas dngos po mi rtag par 'dod pa 'gog ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pas dngos po mi rtag par 'dod pa 'gog ste /
translated: Moreover, the assertion that things are impermanent is refuted by ‚ÄúMoreover, if things were impermanent, etc.‚Äù

original: de la dngos po rtag pa yang ma yin mi rtag pa yang ma yin zhes pa mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de la dngos po rtag pa yang ma yin mi rtag pa yang ma yin zhes pa mi 'thad de /
translated: There, it is not tenable to say that things are neither permanent nor impermanent.

original: de dag ni rnam gcod yongs gcod kyi 'gal ba yin pas gcig bkag pa gzhan bsgrub pa la ltos pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de dag ni rnam gcod yongs gcod kyi 'gal ba yin pas gcig bkag pa gzhan bsgrub pa la ltos pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Since those are mutually exclusive in the sense of one being the contrapositive of the other, the negation of one relies on the affirmation of the other.

original: skyon med de /
analyzed: skyon med de /
translated: There is no fault.

original: dngos po'i ngo bor grub pa 'ga' zhig rtag pa dang mi rtag pa gnyi ga ma yin par 'gal gyi /
analyzed: dngos po'i ngo bor grub pa 'ga' zhig rtag pa dang mi rtag pa gnyi ga ma yin par 'gal gyi /
translated: It is contradictory for something that is established as the entity of an entity to be neither permanent nor impermanent.

original: 'dir dngos po'i ngo bo bden pa grub pa ni med kyi /
analyzed: 'dir dngos po'i ngo bo bden pa grub pa ni med kyi /
translated: However, here there is no establishment of the entity of an entity as truly existent.

original: dngos por snang ba tsam nyid de kho na nyid du rtag pa dang mi rtag pa gnyi ga ma yin zhing /
analyzed: dngos por snang ba tsam nyid de kho na nyid du rtag pa dang mi rtag pa gnyi ga ma yin zhing /
translated: The mere appearance as an entity is neither permanent nor impermanent in reality.

original: dngos po nyid du yang grub pa med ces pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po nyid du yang grub pa med ces pa'o //
translated: It is also not established as an entity.

original: des na dngos po rtag pa dang mi rtag pa ma yin pa bzhin du de dag kyang dngos po ma yin zhes pa'o //
analyzed: des na dngos po rtag pa dang mi rtag pa ma yin pa bzhin du de dag kyang dngos po ma yin zhes pa'o //
translated: Therefore, just as an entity is neither permanent nor impermanent, they are also not entities.

original: de la rtag pa dngos po yin pa ni dgag par sla mod kyi /
analyzed: de la rtag pa dngos po yin pa ni dgag par sla mod kyi /
translated: In that regard, it is easy to refute that a permanent entity is an entity.

original: mi rtag pa dngos po yin pa ji ltar 'gog ce na /
analyzed: mi rtag pa dngos po yin pa ji ltar 'gog ce na /
translated: But how is it that an impermanent entity is refuted?

original: mi rtag pa ni nges 'ga' pa yin pas /
analyzed: mi rtag pa ni nges 'ga' pa yin pas /
translated: Since impermanence is a certain type of thing,

original: rgyu las skye bas khyab la /
analyzed: rgyu las skye bas khyab la /
translated: it is necessarily produced from a cause.

original: de yang skye ba rnam pa bzhi la sogs pas khyab pa las /
analyzed: de yang skye ba rnam pa bzhi la sogs pas khyab pa las /
translated: It is pervaded by the four kinds of birth and so on.üîΩ

original: de kho na nyid du de 'dra ba'i khyab byed mi 'thad pa'i phyir mi rtag pa dngos po nyid du mi 'thad cing /
analyzed: de kho na nyid du de 'dra ba'i khyab byed mi 'thad pa'i phyir mi rtag pa dngos po nyid du mi 'thad cing /
translated: Moreover, impermanence is not tenable as an entity because it is not tenable that it pervades the four types of arising and so on.

original: de nyid kyi phyir dngos po yang mi rtag par bdag nyid ma yin te /üîΩphan tshun bdag nyid ma yin @229a * //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dngos po yang mi rtag par bdag nyid ma yin te / phan tshun bdag nyid ma yin @229a * //
translated: For that reason, an entity is not impermanent by nature,

original: par mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: par mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is similar to that which is not its nature.

original: gal te 'dir mi rtag pa rtsol ba las byung ba'i bdag nyid ma yin kyang /
analyzed: gal te 'dir mi rtag pa rtsol ba las byung ba'i bdag nyid ma yin kyang /
translated: If you say that although impermanence does not arise from effort,

original: rtsol byung mi rtag pa'i bdag nyid yin pa las /
analyzed: rtsol byung mi rtag pa'i bdag nyid yin pa las /
translated: that which arises from effort has the nature of impermanence,

original: phan tshun bdag nyid ma yin par mtshungs pa mi 'thad do zhe na /
analyzed: phan tshun bdag nyid ma yin par mtshungs pa mi 'thad do zhe na /
translated: and therefore it is not tenable that they are similar in not being each other‚Äôs nature,

original: skyon med de /
analyzed: skyon med de /
translated: then that is not a fault.

original: glog dang nags kyi me tog la yod pa'i mi rtag pa rtsol byung gi bdag nyid ma yin pa ltar /
analyzed: glog dang nags kyi me tog la yod pa'i mi rtag pa rtsol byung gi bdag nyid ma yin pa ltar /
translated: Just as the impermanence that exists in lightning and forest flowers does not arise from effort,

original: rtsol byung yang mi rtag pa de 'dra ba'i bdag nyid ma yin par mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtsol byung yang mi rtag pa de 'dra ba'i bdag nyid ma yin par mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: that which arises from effort is similar in not having the nature of such impermanence.

original: 'di las zhes pa la sogs pas kun rdzob tu mi rtag pa la sogs pa 'thad cing /
analyzed: 'di las zhes pa la sogs pas kun rdzob tu mi rtag pa la sogs pa 'thad cing /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúfrom this‚Äù and so on indicates that impermanence and so on are tenable in the conventional sense.

original: de nyid 'ga' zhig gi rgyu nyid du ston pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid 'ga' zhig gi rgyu nyid du ston pa'o //
translated: It also shows that this is the cause of some things.

original: de'i don yang kun rdzob pa'i dngos po thams cad kyi dngos po med pa ste /
analyzed: de'i don yang kun rdzob pa'i dngos po thams cad kyi dngos po med pa ste /
translated: The meaning of this is that the nonexistence of all things that are conventional is the ultimate thing.

original: don dam pa'i dngos por med cing kun rdzob pa'i dngos po nyid du gnas pa ni mi rtag pa'i 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: don dam pa'i dngos por med cing kun rdzob pa'i dngos po nyid du gnas pa ni mi rtag pa'i 'bras bu yin te /
translated: The nonexistence of things in the ultimate sense and the existence of things in the conventional sense is the effect of impermanence.

original: de las gzhan dngos po med pa'am rtag pa ni nus pa thams cad kyis stong pa'i phyir de'i rgyur mi 'thad pa'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan dngos po med pa'am rtag pa ni nus pa thams cad kyis stong pa'i phyir de'i rgyur mi 'thad pa'o //
translated: It is not tenable that anything other than that, that is, something nonexistent or permanent, is its cause, because it is devoid of all efficacy.

original: de nyid dpe'i sgo nas gsal bar ston pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid dpe'i sgo nas gsal bar ston pa ni /
translated: The following verse clarifies this point by means of an example.

original: bcag par bya ba bum pa gyo mo'i gnas skabs su song ba ni dbyig pa la sogs pa med na mi 'byung bas de'i 'bras bu nyid du 'jog pa dang mtshungs pa'o //
analyzed: bcag par bya ba bum pa gyo mo'i gnas skabs su song ba ni dbyig pa la sogs pa med na mi 'byung bas de'i 'bras bu nyid du 'jog pa dang mtshungs pa'o //
translated: The destruction of a pot, which has become a state of shards, is posited as the effect of a hammer and so on, since it does not occur without them.

original: phan tshun bye brag med ces pa ni dpe don phan tshun bye brag med pa'o //
analyzed: phan tshun bye brag med ces pa ni dpe don phan tshun bye brag med pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúno difference between the example and the meaning‚Äù means that there is no difference between the example and the meaning.

original: dngos po thams cad kyi zhes pa'i khyad par smos pa ni /
analyzed: dngos po thams cad kyi zhes pa'i khyad par smos pa ni /
translated: The qualification ‚Äúof all things‚Äù is stated.

original: dngos bo med pa'i med par dgag pa tsam 'bras bur mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos bo med pa'i med par dgag pa tsam 'bras bur mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The specification ‚Äúof all things‚Äù is stated because it is not tenable that a mere nonimplicative negation‚Äîthe nonexistence of things‚Äîis the effect.

original: 'di ni zhes pa la sogs pas de 'dra ba'i rgyu 'bras don dam par ma grub ces ston pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes pa la sogs pas de 'dra ba'i rgyu 'bras don dam par ma grub ces ston pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThis‚Äù and so on teaches that such causes and effects are not ultimately established.

original: de'i don ni dngos po thams cad kyi nang du mi rtag pa nyid kyang 'dus pas /
analyzed: de'i don ni dngos po thams cad kyi nang du mi rtag pa nyid kyang 'dus pas /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows. Since impermanence is included among all things,

original: de yang don dam par ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de yang don dam par ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir /
translated: because it also lacks entityness ultimately,

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu bye brag tu 'jog pa'i rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu bye brag tu 'jog pa'i rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir /
translated: there is no reason to posit it as a cause and effect in particular.

original: de dag gi bye brag med ces pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi bye brag med ces pa'o //
translated: Therefore, there is no distinction between them.

original: de ltar rgyu med pa'i phyir dngos po thams cad med ces pa ni de 'dra ba'i chos nyid la 'gyur ba med pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar rgyu med pa'i phyir dngos po thams cad med ces pa ni de 'dra ba'i chos nyid la 'gyur ba med pa'o //
translated: Thus, because there is no cause, all things are nonexistent. Such a reality is changeless.

original: des na tshig snga phyi 'gal bar 'gyur ba yang med cing /
analyzed: des na tshig snga phyi 'gal bar 'gyur ba yang med cing /
translated: Therefore, there is no contradiction between the earlier and later statements.

original: don dam pa'i dngos po 'ga' zhig mi rtag pa nyid du 'gyur ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam pa'i dngos po 'ga' zhig mi rtag pa nyid du 'gyur ba yang ma yin no //
translated: Also, it is not the case that some ultimate thing becomes impermanent.

original: de ltar don dam par rgyu med cing kun rdzob tu rgyu las skye ba zung du 'jug pa'i don ni byis pa'i skye bo rnams kyis khong du mi chud ces sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar don dam par rgyu med cing kun rdzob tu rgyu las skye ba zung du 'jug pa'i don ni byis pa'i skye bo rnams kyis khong du mi chud ces sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Thus, the meaning of the union of ultimate non-causality and conventional causality should be applied as ‚Äúthe childish do not understand.‚Äù

original: rgyu ni zhes pa la sogs pas kun rdzob tsam du rgyu 'dra ba las 'bras bu mi @229b 'dra ba 'byung ba mi 'thad de /
analyzed: rgyu ni zhes pa la sogs pas kun rdzob tsam du rgyu 'dra ba las 'bras bu mi @229b 'dra ba 'byung ba mi 'thad de /
translated: The verse ‚ÄúThe cause‚Ä¶‚Äù and so on, shows that it is not tenable that a dissimilar effect arises from a cause that is similar merely conventionally.

original: de ltar 'byung du zin na ni dngos po de dag thams cad kyi mi rtag pas 'bras bu mi 'dra ba bskyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar 'byung du zin na ni dngos po de dag thams cad kyi mi rtag pas 'bras bu mi 'dra ba bskyed par 'gyur te /
translated: If that were the case, then all of those things would be impermanent, and thus would give rise to dissimilar effects.

original: 'ga' zhig dngos po med pa'i ngo bor bskyed la /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig dngos po med pa'i ngo bor bskyed la /
translated: Some would be produced as having the nature of non-things.

original: 'ga' zhig ni don dam pa'i dngos po nyid du bskyed bar 'gyur ro //üîΩde lta na yang dngos po rnams kyi 'bras bu 'dra ba dang / mi 'dra ba nyid rgyu med pa can du 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig ni don dam pa'i dngos po nyid du bskyed bar 'gyur ro // de lta na yang dngos po rnams kyi 'bras bu 'dra ba dang / mi 'dra ba nyid rgyu med pa can du 'gyur te /
translated: Some would be produced as ultimate things.üîΩIn that case, the similarity and dissimilarity of the effects of things would be causeless.

original: rgyu 'dra ba dang mi 'dra ba gnyis kas ma bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu 'dra ba dang mi 'dra ba gnyis kas ma bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because neither a similar nor a dissimilar cause would produce them.

original: de la re zhig dngos po rnams kyi mi 'dra ba rgyu 'dra bas bskyed pa ma yin te /üîΩnas dang sran ma la sogs pa'i myu gu la /
analyzed: de la re zhig dngos po rnams kyi mi 'dra ba rgyu 'dra bas bskyed pa ma yin te / nas dang sran ma la sogs pa'i myu gu la /
translated: First, the diversity of things is not generated by a similar cause.üîΩFor example,

original: rgyu 'dra ba med kyang 'bras bu mi 'dra ba nyid du 'gyur bas ldog pa 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu 'dra ba med kyang 'bras bu mi 'dra ba nyid du 'gyur bas ldog pa 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
translated: in the case of sprouts of barley, peas, and so on, even though there is no similar cause, the effect is just different. Therefore, the pervasion is mistaken.

original: de bzhin du 'bras bu mi 'dra ba de nyid rgyu mi 'dra bas bskyed pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'bras bu mi 'dra ba de nyid rgyu mi 'dra bas bskyed pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Similarly, that very different effect is not generated by a different cause.

analyzed: des ni 'joms pa dang blo yis gzhig par mi nus pa'i phyir ro zhes gnas ma'i bu'i sde pa dang / bye brag pas 'dod pa'o // 'di ni mi 'thad de / rab tu 'jig pa ste bum pa la sogs pa gyo mo la sogs pa'i gnas skabs su gyur pa'i sngon rol de dag tu mi 'jig pa dang / mthar 'jig pa yang tho ba la sogs pa'i rgyu la ltos pa yin na /
translated: They are not destroyed by the power of the mind, because they cannot be destroyed by the power of the mind.üîΩThis is untenable because if gross objects are destroyed by the power of the primary elements, then they would not disintegrate prior to the state of shards and so on and their final disintegration would depend on causes such as a hammer.

original: bum pa thog mar grub pa'i dus dang / phyis 'jig ka ma'i gnas skabs gnyis la mi 'dra ba'i khyad par 'ga' zhig yod na ni /

original: pa gnyis te /
analyzed: pa gnyis te /

analyzed: nyan thos kyi dbang du byas pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i dbang du byas pa'o //

analyzed: de'i dang po la bdun te /

translated: the object of negation that is stopped,üîΩthe essence of the meditative attainment of cessation,

translated: and the duration of meditative attainment.üîΩThe person who is the basis

analyzed: de la bdag med par rtogs pa'i 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab dgos par gsungs pa la /
translated: Ordinary beings, ƒÅryas who are stream enterers and once returners are not able to enter the meditative attainment of cessation because it is said that it requires transcendent wisdom that realizes selflessness.

analyzed: 'jig rten pa srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar du thogs pa rnams la yang de 'dra ba'i shes rab med pa'i phyir dang / gzhan yang zhi gnas mthar thug pa srid pa'i rtse mo'i sems thob dgos pa las /
translated: Ordinary beings who are obstructed from the summit of existence and below do not have such wisdom and they must obtain the mind of the summit of existence, the ultimate state of serenity.

original: 'phags pa'i gang zag gnyis po de la de 'dra ba mi 'thad de /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i gang zag gnyis po de la de 'dra ba mi 'thad de /
translated: Such a state is untenable for the two types of ƒÅrya being.üîΩ

original: srid pa'i rtse mo'i sems thob na /
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo'i sems thob na /
translated: It is untenable that such a state exists for the two ƒÅrya beings because if they obtain the mind of the summit of existence,

original: khams 'og ma gnyis kyi nyon mongs pa spangs pas de dag tu skye ba mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khams 'og ma gnyis kyi nyon mongs pa spangs pas de dag tu skye ba mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it is untenable that they are born in lower realms since they abandon affliction of the two lower realms.

original: lan cig phyir mi 'ong ba khyad par can ma yin pa rnams kyang 'dod chags dang bral ba tsam yin kyang /
analyzed: lan cig phyir mi 'ong ba khyad par can ma yin pa rnams kyang 'dod chags dang bral ba tsam yin kyang /

analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa'i dngos gzhi ma thob cing /

analyzed: sred pa'i rtse mo'i sems ma thob pas snyoms par 'jug mi nus la /

original: de dag thob pa'i phyir mi 'ong ba khyad par can ni de la snyoms par 'jug nus pas 'di'i rten gyi gang zag tu 'thad do //
analyzed: de dag thob pa'i phyir mi 'ong ba khyad par can ni de la snyoms par 'jug nus pas 'di'i rten gyi gang zag tu 'thad do //
translated: But it is tenable that special nonreturners who obtain those are persons who are the basis of meditative attainment.

original: 'phags pa dgra bcom pa rgyan med snyoms par 'jug pa la ma sbyangs pa rnams kyang /
analyzed: 'phags pa dgra bcom pa rgyan med snyoms par 'jug pa la ma sbyangs pa rnams kyang /

analyzed: bsam gtan gyi dngos gzhi ma thob pas snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgrib pa dang ldan pa'i phyir 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug mi nus so //

analyzed: des na dgra bcom pa rgyan can srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar gyi sems thob pa rnams ni 'di'i rten nyid du 'thad do //
translated: Therefore it is correct that the basis of this meditative attainment is an arhat possessing the branch of superknowledge who has obtained the mind of the summit of existence.

original: khams gang du snyoms par 'jug pa ni gang zag de gnyis ka yang 'dod pa'i khams gling gsum gyi mi'i nang du dang po thob pa thob par byed cing /
analyzed: khams gang du snyoms par 'jug pa ni gang zag de gnyis ka yang 'dod pa'i khams gling gsum gyi mi'i nang du dang po thob pa thob par byed cing /

original: thob nas zhi ba dang bde bar gnas shing snyoms par 'jug pa ni khams gzhan du yang ngo //
analyzed: thob nas zhi ba dang bde bar gnas shing snyoms par 'jug pa ni khams gzhan du yang ngo //

analyzed: de nyid kyis myur du 'di rnams zhi ba'i 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug par bya snyam pas da ltar thob par byed pa'o //

original: sa ni srid pa'i rtse mo la brten pa ste /
analyzed: sa ni srid pa'i rtse mo la brten pa ste /

analyzed: de nyid 'du shes dang tshor ba cha phra bas dgag par sla ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: rten de la sngar srid pa'i rtse mo'i sems ma thob pa'i dus na /

original: de dag rags pas skyo bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de dag rags pas skyo bar 'gyur zhing /

analyzed: myur du de rnams zhi ba'i 'gog pa thob par bya snyam pa ste /

analyzed: de thob byed kyi yan lag tsam yin la de'i rjes su 'bad pa dang rtsol bas srid pa'i rtse mo'i sems mngon du byas nas de la brten te /

original: 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug pa'o //

analyzed: des na dus snga phyi la ltos te phra ba dang rags pa mi 'gal ba'o //
translated: Thus, it is not contradictory that it is subtle and gross in relation to earlier and later times.

original: 'dir yid la byed pa ni mthong pa'i chos la zhi ba dang bde bar gnas par bya'o snyam pa'i sgo nas snyoms par 'jug gi /'du shes med pa'i snyoms 'jug ltar 'khor ba las nges par 'byung ba'i sems kyis ni ma yin te /

translated: Because this is already the definite emergence of ƒÅryas from cyclic existence.üîΩThe object of cessation is the meditative attainment of cessation.

analyzed: tshogs drug sems la 'byung ba'ang bcas pa 'gog la /

analyzed: nyon mongs ba can gyi yid ni /

analyzed: dgra bcom nyid ni de ldog go //

analyzed: 'gog pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs so // ting nge 'dzin de la gnas nas blo sngon du btang ba bzhin du /

translated: The reason for that is that, by one's own former prayers, etc., and by the Tathagata's blessing, one awakens from that and enters the method of entering the knowledge of the ultimate stage, the Dharmakaya.  The consciousness does not remain long in the bliss of samadhi.

original: gal te rnam par rtog pa'i rigs thams cad spangs pa ni yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rnam par rtog pa'i rigs thams cad spangs pa ni yin nam zhe na /

original: de dag gis zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de dag gis zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs so //

analyzed: chos thams cad zhes pa la sogs pas ni mthar thug pa'i gnas la 'jug pa'i tshul ston te /

original: des zin par byas nas 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: des zin par byas nas 'jug pa'o //

original: de yang ji ltar rmi lam na 'ga' zhig gis 'bad pa dang rtsol ba drag pos chu la rgal bar rmi ba las /

analyzed: gnas skabs de nyid kyis gnyid sad nas de'i de ma thag tu ci 'di bden nam brdzun zhes rtog go //

original: de bzhin du zhes pa la sogs pa phal cher shes par zad do //üîΩdang po nas bdun du 'pho zhes pa ni sa bdun gyi bar la dbang po rnon pos chos thams cad sems kyi snang ba tsam du mngon par rtogs shing /
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes pa la sogs pa phal cher shes par zad do // dang po nas bdun du 'pho zhes pa ni sa bdun gyi bar la dbang po rnon pos chos thams cad sems kyi snang ba tsam du mngon par rtogs shing /
translated: The rest of the passage is easy to understand.üîΩThe first seven are the stages of transition.

original: sems kyang sgyu ma la sogs pa dang mtshungs par rtogs la /
analyzed: sems kyang sgyu ma la sogs pa dang mtshungs par rtogs la /
translated: Those of sharp faculties realize that all phenomena are merely the appearances of the mind and that the mind is like an illusion and so forth.

analyzed: dgag pa'i rnam pa can gyi rtog pa ste /

translated: When they see the movement of good thoughts, they apply their wisdom that has such thoughts to the qualities of buddhahood.

analyzed: de 'dra ba'i rnam par rtog pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa khong du chud par byed pa'i sbyor ba ste @239a * //

translated: On the eighth level, in the state of meditative equipoise, there is no appearance of the duality of percept and perceiver, and in the ensuing attainment, one has attained mastery over nonconceptuality. Therefore, it is called ‚Äúthe level of absence of appearance,‚Äù because there is no fixation on those.

original: de nas dgu pa dang bcu pa gnyis ni chos kyi sku ye shes kyi bdag gi nye ba'i rgyur gyur bas gnas zhes pa'am /
analyzed: de nas dgu pa dang bcu pa gnyis ni chos kyi sku ye shes kyi bdag gi nye ba'i rgyur gyur bas gnas zhes pa'am /

original: yang so so yang dag par rig pa'i ye shes la dbang ba dang / dbang mngon par shes pa'i las la dbang bas chos ston pa dang / phrin las sna tshogs la dbang sbyor ba'i gnas yin pas /
analyzed: yang so so yang dag par rig pa'i ye shes la dbang ba dang / dbang mngon par shes pa'i las la dbang bas chos ston pa dang / phrin las sna tshogs la dbang sbyor ba'i gnas yin pas /

original: de dag ni gnas gyi sa zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ni gnas gyi sa zhes pa'o //

original: de rnams las gzhan sa bcu gcig pa ni /

analyzed: ji ltar me'i phung po la me lce dang 'od zer sna tshogs 'byung ba bzhin du rin po che'i 'od zer sna tshogs pa yid du 'ong ba der skyes pa rnams kyi bsod nams kyi snang ba yin pas 'tshe ba 'am mi mthun pa med par gyur pa

original: ni zhi ba'o //
analyzed: ni zhi ba'o //
